title: The Birth of Winemaking
description: Archaeological evidence suggests wine production began in the Caucasus region (modern-day Georgia), where ancient civilizations fermented wild grapes in clay vessels.

title: Mesopotamian Wine Trade
description: Wine becomes a commodity in Mesopotamia. The Code of Hammurabi includes laws regulating wine sales and quality standards.

title: Wine of the Pharaohs
description: Ancient Egyptians perfect wine storage in amphorae and create the first wine labels, marking vintage and vineyard. Wine becomes essential in religious ceremonies.

title: Greek Wine Culture
description: Greeks spread viticulture across Mediterranean. Symposiums elevate wine to philosophical importance. Development of different grape varieties begins.

title: Roman Innovation
description: Romans revolutionize winemaking with wooden barrels, glass bottles, and widespread viticulture across Europe. Wine becomes daily sustenance for all classes.

title: Monastic Winemaking
description: Monks perfect winemaking techniques in Burgundy and Champagne. Development of terroir concept. Wine becomes essential for communion.

title: Age of Exploration
description: European explorers bring vines to the New World. Spanish and Portuguese establish vineyards in Americas. Wine trade expands globally.

title: Birth of Champagne
description: Dom P√©rignon perfects the m√©thode champenoise, creating sparkling wine. Revolution in bottling and cork technology.

title: Bordeaux Classification
description: The famous 1855 Classification of Bordeaux wines establishes the crus system, still influential today.

title: The Great Phylloxera
description: Phylloxera devastates European vineyards. American rootstocks save the industry through grafting, reshaping global viticulture.

title: Judgment of Paris
description: California wines defeat French wines in blind tasting, revolutionizing wine world and validating New World winemaking.

title: Global Wine Renaissance
description: Technology meets tradition. Sustainable practices, precision viticulture, and climate-adapted varieties shape modern winemaking.
